An argument from the deck pulls your attention away from the gentle rocking of the ship and the smooth expanse of blue on the horizon. 

"Half of those fish were floating belly-up!" cries [Specified 0]. "Better we throw out the whole catch than end up with a rot-bellied crew!"

"They looked alive enough when we hauled them out!" [Specified 1] retorts, gesturing violently at the pile of fish on the deck. "Fish die when you pull them out of the water! That's what fish do!"
[Check the fish for signs of disease.] "Let's judge the fitness of the catch."
"We're in no position to throw away food. Stow the fish in the hold."
"The fish go back in the sea. I won't risk the crew's health."

Several of the fish display discolored scales and bloated bellies - clear signs of disease. It's possible their meat could sicken the crew.

"See?" [Specified 0] asks [Specified 1], scowling. "Are you trying to give us all the squatting splatters?"
"See, [Specified 0]? The captain knows we can't go throwing away perfectly good meals."

"The wisest course, captain." [Specified 0] nods happily. 

The two hands dump the barrel overboard, returning the fish to the sea.

There are no obvious signs of disease to be found - no weeping sores or bleeding eyes - but there could be more subtle signs of piscine health that have been overlooked. 

"If we keep these fish, captain, your crew may be squatting over the bulwarks for days." 

"You worry more than my grandma, [Specified 0]. There's no sign of sickness."

There are no signs of discoloration, open sores, or bloated bellies. The fish appear perfectly healthy.

"I told you it wasn't dangerous," [Specified 1] gloats, arms akimbo.
[Specified 0]'s mouth hangs agape. "Are you serious, captain?"
"What do you think, [Player Animal Companion]?"

[Player Animal Companion] approaches the barrel, sniffs at the fish, and snaps one up, presenting it to you as if a gift. [Specified 1] laughs heartily. 

"Looks like we've got one crew member's approval!"

[Player Animal Companion] sniffs at the fish, then turns up their nose at the barrel. [Specified 0] sighs.

"Seems [Player Animal Companion]'s got more between their ears than some of our fellow sailors."
"You heard me."
"On second thought, throw them over."

[Specified 0] sighs. "If we take these on, captain, there's every chance-"

"Stow it," [Specified 1] barks. "The captain's word is law. Let's get these fish below."

The pair heave the barrel and move it towards the hatch, leaving you to return aft.
[Specified 1] looks to [Player Animal Companion]. "I'm as hungry as the next sailor, but what about [Player Animal Companion]'s reaction?"
[Specified 1] nods vigorously. "I know I wanted to keep them before, but that was before you pointed out the bellies and scales and such."
[Purge the fish of toxins.] "We'll fix this."
Opening your hands above the barrel, you call on the essence in the air around you, driving it through the barrel and eradicating the diseases within.
"We're in no position to throw away food. Stow the fish in the hold."
"The fish go back in the sea. I won't risk the crew's health."
With a few whispered words, you call forth [Player Animal Companion], who manifests on the deck before you.
Hands open above the barrel, [Specified 2] calls on the spirits in the air around you, driving them through the barrel to consume the diseases within.
"You'll fix diseased fish?" [Specified 0] blinks.
